verses.kjv: Now there was a certain man of Ramathaimzophim, of mount Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephrathite:
verses.web: Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim Zophim, of the hill country of Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite.
verses.ct: There was a man named Elkanah who lived in Ramathaim Zophim, in the hill country of Ephraim. He was the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephrathite.

verses.kjv: And he had two wives; the name of the one was Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah: and Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.
verses.web: He had two wives. The name of one was Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah. Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.
verses.ct: Elkanah had 2 wives. One was named Hannah, and the other was named Peninnah. Peninnah had children, but Hannah had none.

verses.kjv: And this man went up out of his city yearly to worship and to sacrifice unto the LORD of hosts in Shiloh. And the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, the priests of the LORD, were there.
verses.web: This man went up out of his city from year to year to worship and to sacrifice to LORD of Armies in Shiloh. The two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, priests to LORD, were there.
verses.ct: Every year, Elkanah traveled from his hometown to Shiloh to worship and offer sacrifices to the LORD of hosts. Eli's 2 sons, Hophni and Phinehas, served there as priests of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And when the time was that Elkanah offered, he gave to Peninnah his wife, and to all her sons and her daughters, portions:
verses.web: When the day came that Elkanah sacrificed, he gave to Peninnah his wife, and to all her sons and her daughters, portions;
verses.ct: Whenever Elkanah offered his sacrifice, he would give portions of the meat to his wife Peninnah and to each of her sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: But unto Hannah he gave a worthy portion; for he loved Hannah: but the LORD had shut up her womb.
verses.web: but to Hannah he gave a double portion, for he loved Hannah, but LORD had shut up her womb.
verses.ct: But to Hannah he always gave a double portion, because he loved her deeply — even though the LORD had kept her from having children.

verses.kjv: And her adversary also provoked her sore, for to make her fret, because the LORD had shut up her womb.
verses.web: Her rival provoked her severely, to irritate her, because LORD had shut up her womb.
verses.ct: Peninnah, her rival, constantly taunted her and tried to upset her because the LORD had closed her womb.

verses.kjv: And as he did so year by year, when she went up to the house of the LORD, so she provoked her; therefore she wept, and did not eat.
verses.web: So year by year, when she went up to LORD’s house, her rival provoked her. Therefore she wept, and didn’t eat.
verses.ct: This went on year after year. Every time they went up to the house of the LORD, Peninnah would provoke Hannah until she broke down crying and couldn't eat.

verses.kjv: Then said Elkanah her husband to her, Hannah, why weepest thou? and why eatest thou not? and why is thy heart grieved? am not I better to thee than ten sons?
verses.web: Elkanah her husband said to her, “Hannah, why do you weep? Why don’t you eat? Why is your heart grieved? Am I not better to you than ten sons?”
verses.ct: Her husband Elkanah would say to her, "Hannah, why are you crying? Why won't you eat? Why are you so heartbroken? Don't I mean more to you than 10 sons?"

verses.kjv: So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest sat upon a seat by a post of the temple of the LORD.
verses.web: So Hannah rose up after they had finished eating and drinking in Shiloh. Now Eli the priest was sitting on his seat by the doorpost of LORD’s temple.
verses.ct: One time after they had finished eating and drinking in Shiloh, Hannah got up and went to pray. Eli the priest was sitting on a chair beside the doorpost of the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: And she was in bitterness of soul, and prayed unto the LORD, and wept sore.
verses.web: She was in bitterness of soul, and prayed to LORD, weeping bitterly.
verses.ct: Hannah was deeply distressed in her soul. She prayed to the LORD, weeping bitterly.

verses.kjv: And she vowed a vow, and said, O LORD of hosts, if thou wilt indeed look on the affliction of thine handmaid, and remember me, and not forget thine handmaid, but wilt give unto thine handmaid a man child, then I will give him unto the LORD all the days of his life, and there shall no razor come upon his head.
verses.web: She vowed a vow, and said, “LORD of Armies, if you will indeed look at the affliction of your servant and remember me, and not forget your servant, but will give to your servant a boy, then I will give him to LORD all the days of his life, and no razor shall come on his head.”
verses.ct: She made a vow, saying, "LORD of hosts, if you will truly look upon my suffering and remember me — if you won't forget your servant but will give me a son — then I will dedicate him to the LORD for his entire life, and no razor will ever touch his head."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as she continued praying before the LORD, that Eli marked her mouth.
verses.web: As she continued praying before LORD, Eli saw her mouth.
verses.ct: As she kept praying before the LORD, Eli watched her mouth closely.

verses.kjv: Now Hannah, she spake in her heart; only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard: therefore Eli thought she had been drunken.
verses.web: Now Hannah spoke in her heart. Only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard. Therefore Eli thought she was drunk.
verses.ct: Hannah was praying silently in her heart. Her lips were moving, but no sound came out. So Eli assumed she was drunk.

verses.kjv: And Eli said unto her, How long wilt thou be drunken? put away thy wine from thee.
verses.web: Eli said to her, “How long will you be drunk? Get rid of your wine!”
verses.ct: Eli said to her, "How long are you going to stay drunk? Put your wine away!"

verses.kjv: And Hannah answered and said, No, my lord, I am a woman of a sorrowful spirit: I have drunk neither wine nor strong drink, but have poured out my soul before the LORD.
verses.web: Hannah answered, “No, my lord, I am a woman of a sorrowful spirit. I have not been drinking wine or strong drink, but I poured out my soul before LORD.
verses.ct: Hannah replied, "No, my lord, I'm not drunk. I'm a woman crushed by grief. I haven't had any wine or strong drink — I've been pouring out my soul before the LORD.

verses.kjv: Count not thine handmaid for a daughter of Belial: for out of the abundance of my complaint and grief have I spoken hitherto.
verses.web: Don’t consider your servant a wicked woman; for I have been speaking out of the abundance of my complaint and my provocation.”
verses.ct: Please don't think I'm a wicked woman. I've been praying like this because my pain and anguish are overwhelming."

verses.kjv: Then Eli answered and said, Go in peace: and the God of Israel grant thee thy petition that thou hast asked of him.
verses.web: Then Eli answered, “Go in peace; and may the God of Israel grant your petition that you have asked of him.”
verses.ct: Eli answered, "Go in peace, and may the God of Israel grant what you've asked of him."

verses.kjv: And she said, Let thine handmaid find grace in thy sight. So the woman went her way, and did eat, and her countenance was no more sad.
verses.web: She said, “Let your servant find favor in your sight.” So the woman went her way and ate; and her facial expression wasn’t sad any more.
verses.ct: She said, "May your servant find favor with you." Then she went on her way, ate something, and the sadness lifted from her face.

verses.kjv: And they rose up in the morning early, and worshipped before the LORD, and returned, and came to their house to Ramah: and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and the LORD remembered her.
verses.web: They rose up in the morning early and worshiped LORD, then returned and came to their house to Ramah. Then Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and LORD remembered her.
verses.ct: Early the next morning, the family got up, worshiped before the LORD, and then traveled home to Ramah. Elkanah slept with his wife Hannah, and the LORD remembered her.

verses.kjv: Wherefore it came to pass, when the time was come about after Hannah had conceived, that she bare a son, and called his name Samuel, saying, Because I have asked him of the LORD.
verses.web: When the time had come, Hannah conceived, and bore a son; and she named him Samuel, saying, “Because I have asked him of LORD.”
verses.ct: In time, Hannah became pregnant and gave birth to a son. She named him Samuel, saying, "Because I asked the LORD for him."

verses.kjv: And the man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer unto the LORD the yearly sacrifice, and his vow.
verses.web: The man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer to LORD the yearly sacrifice and his vow.
verses.ct: When the time came for the yearly sacrifice, Elkanah went up with his whole household to offer their sacrifice to the LORD and to fulfill his vow.

verses.kjv: But Hannah went not up; for she said unto her husband, I will not go up until the child be weaned, and then I will bring him, that he may appear before the LORD, and there abide for ever.
verses.web: But Hannah didn’t go up, for she said to her husband, “Not until the child is weaned; then I will bring him, that he may appear before LORD, and stay there forever.”
verses.ct: But Hannah stayed behind. She told her husband, "I won't go until the boy is weaned. Then I'll bring him to appear before the LORD, and he will stay there permanently."

verses.kjv: And Elkanah her husband said unto her, Do what seemeth thee good; tarry until thou have weaned him; only the LORD establish his word. So the woman abode, and gave her son suck until she weaned him.
verses.web: Elkanah her husband said to her, “Do what seems good to you. Wait until you have weaned him; only may LORD establish his word.” So the woman waited and nursed her son until she weaned him.
verses.ct: Elkanah told her, "Do whatever you think is best. Stay home until you've weaned him. May the LORD fulfill his word." So Hannah stayed and nursed her son until she weaned him.

verses.kjv: And when she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bullocks, and one ephah of flour, and a bottle of wine, and brought him unto the house of the LORD in Shiloh: and the child was young.
verses.web: When she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bulls, and one ephah of meal, and a container of wine, and brought him to LORD’s house in Shiloh. The child was young.
verses.ct: Once he was weaned, she brought him to the house of the LORD in Shiloh, along with 3 bulls, one ephah of flour, and a container of wine. The boy was still very young.

verses.kjv: And they slew a bullock, and brought the child to Eli.
verses.web: They killed the bull, and brought the child to Eli.
verses.ct: They slaughtered a bull and then brought the child to Eli.

verses.kjv: And she said, Oh my lord, as thy soul liveth, my lord, I am the woman that stood by thee here, praying unto the LORD.
verses.web: She said, “Oh, my lord, as your soul lives, my lord, I am the woman who stood by you here, praying to LORD.
verses.ct: Hannah said to him, "My lord, as surely as you live, I am the woman who stood here beside you praying to the LORD.

verses.kjv: For this child I prayed; and the LORD hath given me my petition which I asked of him:
verses.web: I prayed for this child, and LORD has given me my petition which I asked of him.
verses.ct: I prayed for this child, and the LORD granted me what I asked of him.

verses.kjv: Therefore also I have lent him to the LORD; as long as he liveth he shall be lent to the LORD. And he worshipped the LORD there.
verses.web: Therefore I have also given him to LORD. As long as he lives he is given to LORD.” He worshiped LORD there.
verses.ct: So now I am giving him to the LORD. For as long as he lives, he belongs to the LORD." Then he worshiped the LORD there.
